content.description: Start under the roof, as for Wishful Thinking, using the two pinches and move up and left to the sloping shelves. Continue to progress left along the lip area of the roof using heel hooks and more slopers, shelves and sidepulls, to gain the terminus and top-out around the corner.
content.location: The roof side of the Supernova boulder.

content.description: A nice power problem on near friction less rock. Start on a two pinches, where foot placement is paramount for success. Pop to a flat shelf and move up and right for a stiffer grade and likely V6- or continue straight up on better feet bring the grade to V5.
content.location: On the roof side of the Supernova Boulder. Thirty seconds from the parking lot.

content.description: SDS low in the alcove, with feet to your right(or wherever is comfortable) and hands on a couple of small slick holds. Move up right to an intermediate undercling/side pull, before grabbing the open hand sloping edge. Move left to a small crimp and make a final move to exit the crux. Finishes directly after this.
content.location: One the back/northeast side of Boulder 1.

content.description:
Directly after crossing the highway, these boulders are the right most two. The farthest boulder to the right is Pop Start which has 4 lines on it. The first is Tiny Snatch on the left part of the small undercut face and the right is Pop Start. Just right lies two or 3 problems that make excellent warm-ups. 

  The large boulder(left side) is Supernova and features nice warm-ups, two mid-range V6s and a V9. There are approximately 10 problems on the boulder.
